documentation.text:
@notice It keeps the counter track of Product which are added
 @dev Initializing with zero
Create a Public mapping that maps ProductCount (a number) to an Product (struct)

@notice Create event ProductCreated for EVM logging
 @dev This event will be emitted when a new Product has been created

@notice Create event ProductPurchased for EVM logging
 @dev This event will be emitted when a Product has been purchased

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Product Name should be a valid name of length greater than zero"

arguments.value: Product Name should be a valid name of length greater than zero

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Product Price must be greater than zero"

arguments.value: Product Price must be greater than zero

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Product Price must be greater than zero"

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Product Id should be valid between 1 & total product count"

arguments.value: Product Id should be valid between 1 & total product count

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Product Id should be valid between 1 & total product count"

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Buyer should have sufficient balance to purchase product"

arguments.value: Buyer should have sufficient balance to purchase product

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Buyer should have sufficient balance to purchase product"

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Product is already not purchased by Buyer"

arguments.value: Product is already not purchased by Buyer

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Product is already not purchased by Buyer"

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Buyer is not same as seller"

arguments.value: Buyer is not same as seller
